meanings.definition: Juggling: the act of keeping several objects in motion in the air at the same time
meanings.sent1: During the circus show, the clown amazed everyone with his juggling skills.
meanings.sent2: She practiced juggling with colorful balls in the park.
meanings.sent3: The juggling act made the audience burst into laughter when a ball landed on the clown's head.
meanings.sent4: Her juggling of responsibilities at work was like trying to balance spinning plates.
meanings.sent5: The street performer's juggling was so precise, it seemed like magic.

meanings.definition: Juggling: trying to cope with multiple tasks or responsibilities simultaneously
meanings.sent1: As a parent, she often found herself juggling between work and taking care of her children.
meanings.sent2: The CEO was skilled at juggling various projects and deadlines effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: His juggling of work and personal life sometimes felt like a never-ending circus act.
meanings.sent4: Trying to meet all the deadlines felt like juggling flaming torches.
meanings.sent5: The politician's juggling of promises left everyone wondering which one would fall first.
